Description: Six beads made in different shapes and materials. A: One barrel-shaped bead with a flat underside made of jasper, no further decoration. B: Small plant form bead made of yellow faience, flat at the underside, textured on the upper side. C: Two segmented cylindrical beads, made of white faience. Both completely preserved. D: One large disc-shaped bead with bevelled edge, made of white faience. E: One completely preserved cylindrical bead made of turquoise faience.
Acquisition notes: Formerly housed by the Birmingham Museum and Art Gallery and the EES London.
